page.title: 06Llangybi_ Best Kept Village
page.content: In July 1985 Llangybi was again judged Best Kept Village in Gwent in the Small Village category,winning Â£50.00. Over the last twenty years Llangybi has often won,using the prize money to set up a notice board,seat,litter bins and flower beds.The best kept village plaque is erected in a border by the shop. The older cotages cluster round the green with its central oak.The attractive gardens have copper beech,quick thorn or privet hedges.The new houses are mainly open plan with many trees while the back gardens of the pensioner's houses are shielded by high black fencing.There are several open areas but no playing field,but the Community Council hope to develope the former school field.
